symposium.model

Class ConstraintFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • symposium.model.ConstraintFactory

  • public class ConstraintFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    ConstraintFactory creates constraints objects using their predetermined priority number

    • Method Detail

      • buildConstraints

        public static java.util.List<Constraint> buildConstraints(Panel panel,
                                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> constraint_strings)
        This is our main factory method, which is called from Panel. Each time this is called, a list of constraint names (string) is sent in. For each string, we create an actual constraint object using the predetermined priority number Once the method has looped over all constraints, it returns a list of the constraint objects for the Panel to store
        Parameters:
        panel - is the panel that is calling this method, given because most constraints require their assigned panel to instantiate
        constraint_strings - is a list of names corresponding to constraint objects
        Returns:
        a list of constraint objects for the panel that called this method

      • intToPriority

        private static ConstraintPriority intToPriority(int level)
        Helper method to simply converts an integer value to a priority type (REQUIRED, VERY_IMPORTANT, or DESIRED.)
        Parameters:
        level - an integer between 1-3
        Returns:
        the corresponding priority type (or DESIRED if the given number doesn't map to a priority type)
